metadata.purpose: Continue communications with new customers through activation and ongoing engagement activities. The process ensures new corporate clients receive consistent touchpoints from Day 1 (sign-in) through Day 180, building relationship and driving product activation through multi-channel communications including SMS, email, chat, video content, and personal calls from branch and call centre staff.
metadata.trigger: The process is triggered when a prospective corporate client initiates first contact with an onboarding request, AND that contact is formally registered in the bank's system of record (CRM/case management). Trigger Type: Client-initiated, system-captured. The client's outreach (via phone, email, web form, or branch visit) must be logged to create an auditable starting point. Pre-condition: Prior exposure to marketing channels (website, advertising) that informed the client about corporate banking offerings. The formal registration timestamp marks Day 0 for all SLA and regulatory reporting purposes.
metadata.frequency: Continuous. Onboarding requests are received throughout the day, every business day. The process operates as a steady flow rather than batch processing.
metadata.volume: Very High - 200+ corporate client onboarding requests per month. At this volume, the bank manages hundreds of concurrent 180-day journeys at any given time, with approximately 1,200+ clients active in the onboarding pipeline.

process_exceptions.name: Defence Client Additional Approval
process_exceptions.description: When a prospective corporate client operates in the defence sector, the standard onboarding journey is placed on full hold until additional KYC approval is obtained.
handling_procedure: Defence sector client identified at intake
Standard onboarding journey paused (no communications sent)
Case escalated to KYC Team for additional approval
KYC Team reviews and approves/rejects (3-5 business days)
If approved: Standard journey begins from Day 1
If rejected: Client notified, onboarding terminated

pain_points.name: No Client Portal
pain_points.description: There is no self-service client portal. Clients must always contact the ACO team to initiate onboarding - they cannot start the process themselves, track progress, or access information online.
pain_points.narrative:
The absence of a self-service client portal creates a significant operational bottleneck in the corporate client onboarding process. Staff must handle all client inquiries and onboarding initiation requests manually through email, with no automated self-service channel available. This affects the pre-process stage through PS-01-001 (Sign in) and all subsequent communication steps, as clients have no visibility into their onboarding progress and must contact the ACO team for every interaction.

The quantified impact is substantial: staff spend a minimum of one hour per day reading and responding to emails that could be handled through self-service. This administrative burden directly reduces selling capacity, as relationship managers and sales staff have less time available for revenue-generating activities. At a volume of 200+ corporate client onboarding requests per month, this email overhead compounds significantly across the team.

Currently, there is no formal workaround in place — staff absorb the email volume as part of their daily workload, accepting reduced sales productivity as an unavoidable cost. Improvement ideas already captured include building a full client portal for self-service initiation and progress tracking, or implementing a web form as a quick-win minimum viable solution.
pain_points.root_cause: No digital self-service channel exists for corporate client onboarding
pain_points.quantified_impact: Minimum 1 hour/day on email handling; reduced sales capacity
pain_points.workarounds: No formal workaround — staff absorb email volume as daily workload
problems_caused: No self-service initiation - clients must contact ACO
No visibility into onboarding progress for clients
improvement_ideas: Build a client portal - self-service onboarding initiation and progress tracking
Add a web form (minimum) - online form to start the process
pain_points.quick_win: Web form could be quick win; full portal requires more effort

pain_points.name: Manual Email Handoffs Between Teams
pain_points.description: All handoffs between teams (Marketing → Sales → Call Centre → Branch) are coordinated via email. There is no system-based workflow or automatic task assignment.
pain_points.root_cause: No integrated workflow system connecting teams
problems_caused: Risk of emails being missed or delayed
No audit trail of who did what and when
Manual effort to track and coordinate
Difficult to report on process performance
Clients may fall through the cracks
improvement_ideas: Implement workflow automation with task assignment
Use a shared CRM/case management system
Automated triggers when client moves to next stage

enhancement_ideas.name: Full Client Portal with Status Tracking
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Build a comprehensive client portal where corporate clients can initiate onboarding, upload documents, and track their application status in real-time throughout the 180-day journey.
enhancement_ideas.innovation_source: Internal analysis + Metro Commercial Bank benchmark

enhancement_ideas.name: Simple Web Form for Initiation
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement a simple online web form allowing corporate clients to initiate onboarding requests without needing to send emails or call. Quick-win stepping stone to full portal.

enhancement_ideas.name: Automated KYC Status Email (Day 2)
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Send automated status update email on Day 2 of KYC review period, informing client their application is being processed and providing expected timeline.

enhancement_ideas.name: Defence Sector Status Communication
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement proactive status emails every 2 days during extended KYC review for defence sector clients, explaining the additional verification requirements.

enhancement_ideas.name: Day 120 + Day 150 Touchpoints
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Add two additional touchpoints at Day 120 and Day 150 to bridge the 90-day communication gap, maintaining engagement through the final phase.

enhancement_ideas.name: Unified CRM with Client View
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement unified CRM system across all 4 teams (Marketing, Sales, Call Centre, Branch) providing single view of client journey and eliminating information silos.

enhancement_ideas.name: Auto-Responder with SLA Commitment
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement immediate auto-responder for all corporate onboarding inquiries, confirming receipt and committing to specific response SLA (e.g., 'We will respond within 4 business hours').

enhancement_ideas.name: Dedicated Corporate Onboarding Email
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Create dedicated email address for corporate onboarding (e.g., corporate.onboarding@bank.com) separate from generic inbox, with specialized routing and priority handling.

enhancement_ideas.name: Upfront Document Checklist
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Provide comprehensive upfront document checklist at initial contact, specifying all required documents by client type. Reduce average document rounds from 3 to 1.

enhancement_ideas.name: Assign Named Relationship Manager
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Assign dedicated relationship manager to each corporate client at onboarding start, providing single point of contact throughout 180-day journey and beyond.

enhancement_ideas.name: Fully Digital Onboarding Platform
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Build comprehensive digital onboarding platform with end-to-end automation, document upload, e-signatures, real-time status, and self-service capabilities.

enhancement_ideas.name: AI-Powered Document Verification
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement AI/ML-based document verification to automatically validate completeness, extract data, and flag issues — reducing manual review time and document rounds.

enhancement_ideas.name: Open API Integration
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Develop open API layer enabling integration with client ERP systems, third-party KYC providers, and partner services for streamlined data exchange.

enhancement_ideas.name: AI Chatbot for 24/7 Support
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Deploy AI-powered chatbot on corporate banking portal providing 24/7 support for onboarding queries, document guidance, and status updates.

enhancement_ideas.name: Personalized Journey Paths
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement journey personalization based on client segment, industry, and engagement patterns — adapting communication frequency, channels, and content to client preferences.

enhancement_ideas.name: Predictive Next-Best-Action
enhancement_ideas.proposed_solution: Implement predictive analytics with three-tier maturity: (1) Rules-based triggers for immediate value, (2) Statistical propensity scoring, (3) Full ML real-time decisioning. Start with quick-win rules: no engagement after Day 14 → flag for call; defence KYC >5 days → RM outreach; no activation by Day 30 → branch escalation.
enhancement_ideas.ces_reduction_estimate: -5 points (reduced anxiety through proactive outreach, preventing negative experiences)
enhancement_ideas.innovation_source: Commonwealth Bank Australia (55M decisions/day); Industry benchmarks (25-30% churn reduction, 40% cross-sell improvement)
enhancement_ideas.linked_pain_point: PP-OCC-002 (Manual Handoffs) — NBA tells staff what action to take, not just who to contact
enhancement_ideas.implementation_considerations: Three-tier implementation: Tier 1 (rules-based) as quick win using existing data; Tier 2 (statistical scoring) requires data consolidation; Tier 3 (full ML) requires unified CRM and event-driven architecture. Current systems (Genesys, email, SMS) are siloed — data consolidation needed for advanced tiers.
enhancement_ideas.expected_benefits: CX: Proactive outreach reduces anxiety, prevents disengagement. Ops: Staff guided on what action to take. ROI: 25-30% churn reduction, 40% cross-sell improvement, 20% fewer support inquiries.
quick_win_triggers: No engagement after Day 14 email → proactive call
Defence sector KYC >5 days → RM outreach
No activation by Day 30 → branch escalation
enhancement_ideas.narrative:
The Predictive Next-Best-Action enhancement addresses the fundamentally reactive nature of the current corporate client onboarding communication approach. Rather than waiting for clients to disengage or escalate issues, this capability would enable the bank to identify at-risk clients proactively and trigger timely outreach before problems materialize. The enhancement draws inspiration from Commonwealth Bank Australia's Customer Engagement Engine, which processes 55 million decisions daily, though the implementation should start more pragmatically with rules-based automation as a quick-win foundation.

The technical implementation follows a three-tier maturity model: starting with rules-based triggers using existing data signals (Tier 1), progressing to statistical propensity scoring (Tier 2), and eventually achieving full ML-powered real-time decisioning (Tier 3). Critical dependencies exist with EI-OCC-006 (Unified CRM) for data consolidation across the current siloed systems — Genesys for calls, email platform, and SMS — and EI-OCC-015 (Personalized Journeys) for contextual relevance.

From a client experience perspective, this enhancement targets three critical moments that matter: the KYC silence period (Days 2-5) where client anxiety peaks, the Day 30 activation milestone where clients evaluate whether the relationship is working, and the Day 90-180 communication gap where disengagement risk is highest. Market validation is strong: banks implementing predictive engagement report 25-30% reduction in client churn during onboarding, 40% improvement in cross-sell success, and 20% fewer support inquiries.
